In his speech in MKE today
column4: Russ discussed the importance of paid family leave for working Wisconsinites. #Russ4Us http://t.co/38g5tygNXn

text: #Russ4Us http://t.co/Y04hkagG26
#Russ4Us http://t.co/ar3upy4W7R
Russ on TPP: “It doesn’t matter how you dress it up
column4: it’s still a giveaway to corporations & a punch in the gut to working Wisconsinites.”

text: “Second
column4: the Senate must never again threaten a shutdown of our government for partisan game-playing and one-upmanship.” #Russ4Us

text: #Russ4Us http://t.co/GcFi6fXeWM
“But still today
column4: Democrats and Republicans both agree that banks are still ‘too big to fail.’” #Russ4Us

text: “I was one of only 8 Senators to vote against repealing the law that prevented investment banks from gambling w/ our savings account.”
“There’s work to be done in the Senate to lay the groundwork for an economy that works for all Wisconsinites.” #Russ4Us
“Everyone agrees that building a career
column4: a family
column5: & a future is rarely easy. But far too many say the work & worry they do to scrape by.”

text: #Russ4Us http://t.co/vYsiXeeMHS
“Finally
column4: we must provide paid family leave for parents.” #Russ4Us

text: “We must help families have access to lending that’s available
column4: transparent
column5: and fair.” #Russ4Us

text: “Imagine such a country -- where our doctors
column4: our teachers
column5: our scientists -- come almost exclusively from families of privilege.” #Russ4Us

text: “Too many in Washington
column4: like the incumbent Senator
column5: have no idea what it’s like to need student loans.” #Russ4Us

text: #Russ4Us http://t.co/oCevai0EI7
“But we can act now
column4: by making student loans subject to refinancing
column5: just like we do with mortgages.” #Russ4Us

text: “Student debt is now an economic crisis
column4: totaling nearly $1.2 trillion of debt
column5: with seven in ten Wisconsinites graduating in debt in 2013.”

text: “My likely opponent
column4: the incumbent senator
column5: opposes entirely a federal minimum wage.” #Russ4Us

text: #Russ4Us http://t.co/VzjMqdEnnI
“Raising the minimum wage to $12 would mean a raise for nearly 400
column4: 000 women in Wisconsin and help to close the gender wage gap.” #Russ4Us

text: “Just matching inflation since the ‘70s would add more than two dollars to our current federal minimum wage.” #Russ4Us
“Basics like food and housing have become more expensive
column4: but comparatively the buying power of the minimum wage has decreased.” #Russ4Us

text: “Our federal minimum wage -- $7.25 -- has not come close to matching inflation.” #Russ4Us
“Sometimes
column4: people tell me they can’t pay their bills because their wages are just too low.” #Russ4Us

text: “I am alarmed by how many people who have a job -- or multiple jobs
column4: tell me that they still can’t pay their bills.” #Russ4Us

text: #Russ4Us http://t.co/2zGKHqa6qR
“Joe Ruskey
column4: owner of Dependable Solutions… brought up the issue of broadband
column5: specifically
column6: the lack of broadband access in that region.”

text: “In June
column4: I had the opportunity to sit down for lunch with a number of community leaders and business owners in Prairie du Chien.”

text: “Also
column4: I frequently heard across WI the concern that we need to invest in our transportation
column5: water

text: “It will benefit not just our students
column4: but the employers who are so eager or even desperate for qualified workers.” #Russ4Us

text: “I’m encouraged by proposals to make 2-year community college programs more accessible.” #Russ4Us
“Trained welders once were hard to come by
column4: the demand has now shifted to those specializing in auto electric & heavy diesel mechanics.”

text: #Russ4Us http://t.co/N12Es9e05B
“Just last month
column4: in beautiful Forest County
column5: in northeast Wisconsin
column6: I visited Hometown Trolley in Crandon.” #Russ4Us

text: “Despite a top-line unemployment rate that’s fallen
column4: some people in Wisconsin still can’t find a good-paying job.” #Russ4Us

text: “The promise of a full economic recovery has sometimes seemed possible
column4: but so far has still fallen short.” #Russ4Us

text: “As I travel the state
column4: I hear the same concern: this economy still isn’t working well enough for the families in WI who work the hardest.”

text: “Wall Street earnings reports are up. Those at the very top have recovered
column4: and then some.” #Russ4Us

text: “We’ve made some progress. In October ’09
column4: unemployment peaked at 10% -- last month
column5: our national unemployment rate was 5.3%.” #Russ4Us

text: “The people of WI want us to get things done that will move us toward greater economic well-being for all WI families.” #Russ4Us
“That’s the reason I’m running for the U.S. Senate: to help provide the leadership in Washington to actually get things done.” #Russ4Us
“This work requires listening
column4: and then it requires action -- not lectures
column5: excuses

text: “The spirit of unity is still Wisconsin’s guiding principle.” #Russ4Us
“Despite the attempts to divide and conquer us
column4: the people I’ve met across WI still carry WI’s traditions of optimism and collaboration.”

text: “The people of Wisconsin deserve respect -- all of the people of Wisconsin deserve respect. They should be listened to first.” #Russ4Us
“By the end of this week
column4: I will have heard from people in all 72 counties.” -RDF #Russ4Us
